Misconfigurations.Title: Web App accepts incoming client certificate
Misconfigurations.Description: The TLS mutual authentication technique in enterprise environments ensures the authenticity of clients to the server. If incoming client certificates are enabled only an authenticated client with valid certificates can access the app.
Misconfigurations.Message: App service does not have client certificates enabled.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable incoming certificates for clients

Misconfigurations.Title: Web App has registration with AD enabled
Misconfigurations.Description: Registering the identity used by an App with AD allows it to interact with other services without using username and password
Misconfigurations.Message: App service does not have an identity type.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Register the app identity with AD

Misconfigurations.Title: App Service authentication is activated
Misconfigurations.Description: Enabling authentication ensures that all communications in the application are authenticated. The auth_settings block needs to be filled out with the appropriate auth backend settings
Misconfigurations.Message: App service does not have authentication enabled.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable authentication to prevent anonymous request being accepted

Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure the Function App can only be accessed via HTTPS. The default is false.
Misconfigurations.Description: By default, clients can connect to function endpoints by using both HTTP or HTTPS. You should redirect HTTP to HTTPs because HTTPS uses the SSL/TLS protocol to provide a secure connection, which is both encrypted and authenticated.
Misconfigurations.Message: Function app does not have HTTPS enforced.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: You can redirect all HTTP requests to the HTTPS port.

Misconfigurations.Title: Web App uses the latest HTTP version
Misconfigurations.Description: Use the latest version of HTTP to ensure you are benefiting from security fixes
Misconfigurations.Message: App service does not have HTTP/2 enabled.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Use the latest version of HTTP

Misconfigurations.Title: Web App uses latest TLS version
Misconfigurations.Description: Use a more recent TLS/SSL policy for the App Service
Misconfigurations.Message: App service does not require a secure TLS version.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: The TLS version being outdated and has known vulnerabilities

Misconfigurations.Title: Storage accounts should be configured to only accept transfers that are over secure connections
Misconfigurations.Description:
You can configure your storage account to accept requests from secure connections only by setting the Secure transfer required property for the storage account.
When you require secure transfer, any requests originating from an insecure connection are rejected.
Microsoft recommends that you always require secure transfer for all of your storage accounts.
Misconfigurations.Message: Account does not enforce HTTPS.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Only allow secure connection for transferring data into storage accounts

Misconfigurations.Title: Trusted Microsoft Services should have bypass access to Storage accounts
Misconfigurations.Description:
Some Microsoft services that interact with storage accounts operate from networks that can't be granted access through network rules.
To help this type of service work as intended, allow the set of trusted Microsoft services to bypass the network rules
Misconfigurations.Message: Network rules do not allow bypass for Microsoft Services.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Allow Trusted Microsoft Services to bypass

Misconfigurations.Title: The minimum TLS version for Storage Accounts should be TLS1_2
Misconfigurations.Description:
Azure Storage currently supports three versions of the TLS protocol: 1.0, 1.1, and 1.2.
Azure Storage uses TLS 1.2 on public HTTPS endpoints, but TLS 1.0 and TLS 1.1 are still supported for backward compatibility.
This check will warn if the minimum TLS is not set to TLS1_2.
Misconfigurations.Message: Storage account uses an insecure TLS version.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Use a more recent TLS/SSL policy for the load balancer

Misconfigurations.Title: The default action on Storage account network rules should be set to deny
Misconfigurations.Description:
The default_action for network rules should come into effect when no other rules are matched.
The default action should be set to Deny.
Misconfigurations.Message: Network rules allow access by default.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set network rules to deny

Misconfigurations.Title: Key vault should have the network acl block specified
Misconfigurations.Description:
Network ACLs allow you to reduce your exposure to risk by limiting what can access your key vault.

The default action of the Network ACL should be set to deny for when IPs are not matched. Azure services can be allowed to bypass.
Misconfigurations.Message: Vault network ACL does not block access by default.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set a network ACL for the key vault

Misconfigurations.Title: Key vault should have purge protection enabled
Misconfigurations.Description:
Purge protection is an optional Key Vault behavior and is not enabled by default.

Purge protection can only be enabled once soft-delete is enabled. It can be turned on via CLI or PowerShell.
Misconfigurations.Message: Vault does not have purge protection enabled.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable purge protection for key vaults

Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure databases are not publicly accessible
Misconfigurations.Description: Database resources should not publicly available. You should limit all access to the minimum that is required for your application to function.
Misconfigurations.Message: Database server has public network access enabled.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Disable public access to database when not required

Misconfigurations.Title: Databases should have the minimum TLS set for connections
Misconfigurations.Description: You should not use outdated/insecure TLS versions for encryption. You should be using TLS v1.2+.
Misconfigurations.Message: Database server does not require a secure TLS version.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Use the most modern TLS policies available

Misconfigurations.Title: Auditing should be enabled on Azure SQL Databases
Misconfigurations.Description: Auditing helps you maintain regulatory compliance, understand database activity, and gain insight into discrepancies and anomalies that could indicate business concerns or suspected security violations.
Misconfigurations.Message: Server does not have an extended audit policy configured.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable auditing on Azure SQL databases

Misconfigurations.Title: Cloudtrail should be enabled in all regions regardless of where your AWS resources are generally homed
Misconfigurations.Description: Activity could be happening in your account in a different region. When creating Cloudtrail in the AWS Management Console the trail is configured by default to be multi-region, this isn't the case with the Terraform resource. Cloudtrail should cover the full AWS account to ensure you can track changes in regions you are not actively operating in.
Misconfigurations.Message: Trail is not enabled across all regions.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable Cloudtrail in all regions

Misconfigurations.Title: CloudTrail should use Customer managed keys to encrypt the logs
Misconfigurations.Description: Using AWS managed keys does not allow for fine grained control.  Using Customer managed keys provides comprehensive control over cryptographic keys, enabling management of policies, permissions, and rotation, thus enhancing security and compliance measures for sensitive data and systems.
Misconfigurations.Message: CloudTrail does not use a customer managed key to encrypt the logs.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Use Customer managed key

Misconfigurations.Title: Cloudtrail log validation should be enabled to prevent tampering of log data
Misconfigurations.Description: Illicit activity could be removed from the logs. Log validation should be activated on Cloudtrail logs to prevent the tampering of the underlying data in the S3 bucket. It is feasible that a rogue actor compromising an AWS account might want to modify the log data to remove trace of their actions.
Misconfigurations.Message: Trail does not have log validation enabled.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Turn on log validation for Cloudtrail

Misconfigurations.Title: aws_instance should activate session tokens for Instance Metadata Service.
Misconfigurations.Description: IMDS v2 (Instance Metadata Service) introduced session authentication tokens which improve security when talking to IMDS. By default aws_instance resource sets IMDS session auth tokens to be optional. To fully protect IMDS you need to enable session tokens by using metadata_options block and its http_tokens variable set to required.
Misconfigurations.Message: Instance does not require IMDS access to require a token.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable HTTP token requirement for IMDS

Misconfigurations.Title: RDS Cluster and RDS instance should have backup retention longer than default 1 day
Misconfigurations.Description: RDS backup retention for clusters defaults to 1 day, this may not be enough to identify and respond to an issue. Backup retention periods should be set to a period that is a balance on cost and limiting risk.
Misconfigurations.Message: Instance has very low backup retention period.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Explicitly set the retention period to greater than the default

Misconfigurations.Title: RDS encryption has not been enabled at a DB Instance level.
Misconfigurations.Description:
Encryption should be enabled for an RDS Database instances.
When enabling encryption by setting the kms_key_id.
Misconfigurations.Message: Instance does not have storage encryption enabled.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable encryption for RDS instances

Misconfigurations.Title: S3 Access block should block public ACL
Misconfigurations.Description: S3 buckets should block public ACLs on buckets and any objects they contain. By blocking, PUTs with fail if the object has any public ACL a.
Misconfigurations.Message: Public access block does not block public ACLs
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable blocking any PUT calls with a public ACL specified

Misconfigurations.Title: S3 Access block should block public policy
Misconfigurations.Description: S3 bucket policy should have block public policy to prevent users from putting a policy that enable public access.
Misconfigurations.Message: Public access block does not block public policies
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Prevent policies that allow public access being PUT

Misconfigurations.Title: Unencrypted S3 bucket.
Misconfigurations.Description: S3 Buckets should be encrypted to protect the data that is stored within them if access is compromised.
Misconfigurations.Message: Bucket does not have encryption enabled
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Configure bucket encryption

Misconfigurations.Title: S3 Bucket Logging
Misconfigurations.Description: Ensures S3 bucket logging is enabled for S3 buckets
Misconfigurations.Message: Bucket has logging disabled
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Add a logging block to the resource to enable access logging

Misconfigurations.Title: S3 Data should be versioned
Misconfigurations.Description:
Versioning in Amazon S3 is a means of keeping multiple variants of an object in the same bucket.

You can use the S3 Versioning feature to preserve, retrieve, and restore every version of every object stored in your buckets.

With versioning you can recover more easily from both unintended user actions and application failures.

When you enable versioning, also keep in mind the potential costs of storing noncurrent versions of objects. To help manage those costs, consider setting up an S3 Lifecycle configuration.
Misconfigurations.Message: Bucket does not have versioning enabled
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable versioning to protect against accidental/malicious removal or modification

Misconfigurations.Title: S3 Access Block should Ignore Public ACL
Misconfigurations.Description: S3 buckets should ignore public ACLs on buckets and any objects they contain. By ignoring rather than blocking, PUT calls with public ACLs will still be applied but the ACL will be ignored.
Misconfigurations.Message: Public access block does not ignore public ACLs
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable ignoring the application of public ACLs in PUT calls

Misconfigurations.Title: S3 Buckets not publicly accessible through ACL.
Misconfigurations.Description: Buckets should not have ACLs that allow public access
Misconfigurations.Message: Bucket has a public ACL: "public-read"
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Don't use canned ACLs or switch to private acl

Misconfigurations.Title: S3 Access block should restrict public bucket to limit access
Misconfigurations.Description: S3 buckets should restrict public policies for the bucket. By enabling, the restrict_public_buckets, only the bucket owner and AWS Services can access if it has a public policy.
Misconfigurations.Message: Public access block does not restrict public buckets
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Limit the access to public buckets to only the owner or AWS Services (eg; CloudFront)

Misconfigurations.Title: Security groups should not allow unrestricted ingress to SSH or RDP from any IP address.
Misconfigurations.Description:
Security groups provide stateful filtering of ingress and egress network traffic to AWS
resources. It is recommended that no security group allows unrestricted ingress access to
remote server administration ports, such as SSH to port 22 and RDP to port 3389.
Misconfigurations.Message: Security group rule allows unrestricted ingress from any IP address.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set a more restrictive CIDR range

Misconfigurations.Title: Security groups should not allow unrestricted ingress to SSH or RDP from any IP address.
Misconfigurations.Description:
Security groups provide stateful filtering of ingress and egress network traffic to AWS
resources. It is recommended that no security group allows unrestricted ingress access to
remote server administration ports, such as SSH to port 22 and RDP to port 3389.
Misconfigurations.Message: Security group rule allows unrestricted ingress from any IP address.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set a more restrictive CIDR range

Misconfigurations.Title: Missing description for security group rule.
Misconfigurations.Description:
Security group rules should include a description for auditing purposes.

Simplifies auditing, debugging, and managing security groups.
Misconfigurations.Message: Security group rule does not have a description.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Add descriptions for all security groups rules

Misconfigurations.Title: Missing description for security group rule.
Misconfigurations.Description:
Security group rules should include a description for auditing purposes.

Simplifies auditing, debugging, and managing security groups.
Misconfigurations.Message: Security group rule does not have a description.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Add descriptions for all security groups rules

Simplifies auditing, debugging, and managing security groups.
Misconfigurations.Message: Security group rule does not have a description.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Add descriptions for all security groups rules

Misconfigurations.Message: Security group rule does not have a description.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Add descriptions for all security groups rules

Misconfigurations.Title: Missing description for security group rule.
Misconfigurations.Description:
Security group rules should include a description for auditing purposes.

Simplifies auditing, debugging, and managing security groups.
Misconfigurations.Message: Security group rule does not have a description.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Add descriptions for all security groups rules

Misconfigurations.Title: Instance with unencrypted block device.
Misconfigurations.Description: Block devices should be encrypted to ensure sensitive data is held securely at rest.
Misconfigurations.Message: Root block device is not encrypted.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Turn on encryption for all block devices

Misconfigurations.Title: S3 encryption should use Customer Managed Keys
Misconfigurations.Description: Encryption using AWS keys provides protection for your S3 buckets. To increase control of the encryption and manage factors like rotation use customer managed keys.
Misconfigurations.Message: Bucket does not encrypt data with a customer managed key.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable encryption using customer managed keys

Misconfigurations.Title: Enable Performance Insights to detect potential problems
Misconfigurations.Description:
Enabling Performance insights allows for greater depth in monitoring data.
For example, information about active sessions could help diagose a compromise or assist in the investigation
Misconfigurations.Message: Instance does not have performance insights enabled.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable performance insights

Misconfigurations.Title: CloudTrail logs should be stored in S3 and also sent to CloudWatch Logs
Misconfigurations.Description:
Realtime log analysis is not available without enabling CloudWatch logging.

CloudTrail is a web service that records AWS API calls made in a given account. The recorded information includes the identity of the API caller, the time of the API call, the source IP address of the API caller, the request parameters, and the response elements returned by the AWS service.

CloudTrail uses Amazon S3 for log file storage and delivery, so log files are stored durably. In addition to capturing CloudTrail logs in a specified Amazon S3 bucket for long-term analysis, you can perform real-time analysis by configuring CloudTrail to send logs to CloudWatch Logs.

For a trail that is enabled in all Regions in an account, CloudTrail sends log files from all those Regions to a CloudWatch Logs log group.
Misconfigurations.Message: Trail does not have CloudWatch logging configured
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable logging to CloudWatch

Misconfigurations.Title: RDS IAM Database Authentication Disabled
Misconfigurations.Description: Ensure IAM Database Authentication is enabled for RDS database instances to manage database access
Misconfigurations.Message: Instance does not have IAM Authentication enabled
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Modify the PostgreSQL and MySQL type RDS instances to enable IAM database authentication.

Misconfigurations.Title: RDS Deletion Protection Disabled
Misconfigurations.Description: Ensure deletion protection is enabled for RDS database instances.
Misconfigurations.Message: Instance does not have Deletion Protection enabled
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Modify the RDS instances to enable deletion protection.

Misconfigurations.Title: RDS Publicly Accessible
Misconfigurations.Description: Ensures RDS instances and RDS Cluster instances are not launched into the public cloud.
Misconfigurations.Message: Instance has Public Access enabled
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Remove the public endpoint from the RDS instance.

Misconfigurations.Title: CloudWatch log groups should be encrypted using CMK
Misconfigurations.Description: CloudWatch log groups are encrypted by default, however, to get the full benefit of controlling key rotation and other KMS aspects a KMS CMK should be used.
Misconfigurations.Message: Log group is not encrypted.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable CMK encryption of CloudWatch Log Groups

Misconfigurations.Title: aws_instance should activate session tokens for Instance Metadata Service.
Misconfigurations.Description: IMDS v2 (Instance Metadata Service) introduced session authentication tokens which improve security when talking to IMDS. By default aws_instance resource sets IMDS session auth tokens to be optional. To fully protect IMDS you need to enable session tokens by using metadata_options block and its http_tokens variable set to required.
Misconfigurations.Message: Instance does not require IMDS access to require a token.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable HTTP token requirement for IMDS

Misconfigurations.Title: Load balancers should drop invalid headers
Misconfigurations.Description:
Passing unknown or invalid headers through to the target poses a potential risk of compromise.
By setting drop_invalid_header_fields to true, anything that does not conform to well known, defined headers will be removed by the load balancer.
Misconfigurations.Message: Application load balancer is not set to drop invalid headers.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set drop_invalid_header_fields to true

Misconfigurations.Title: Load balancer is exposed to the internet.
Misconfigurations.Description: There are many scenarios in which you would want to expose a load balancer to the wider internet, but this check exists as a warning to prevent accidental exposure of internal assets. You should ensure that this resource should be exposed publicly.
Misconfigurations.Message: Load balancer is exposed publicly.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Switch to an internal load balancer or add a tfsec ignore

Misconfigurations.Title: Lambda functions should have X-Ray tracing enabled
Misconfigurations.Description: X-Ray tracing enables end-to-end debugging and analysis of all function activity. This will allow for identifying bottlenecks, slow downs and timeouts.
Misconfigurations.Message: Function does not have tracing enabled.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable tracing

Misconfigurations.Title: RDS Cluster and RDS instance should have backup retention longer than default 1 day
Misconfigurations.Description: RDS backup retention for clusters defaults to 1 day, this may not be enough to identify and respond to an issue. Backup retention periods should be set to a period that is a balance on cost and limiting risk.
Misconfigurations.Message: Instance has very low backup retention period.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Explicitly set the retention period to greater than the default

Misconfigurations.Title: RDS encryption has not been enabled at a DB Instance level.
Misconfigurations.Description:
Encryption should be enabled for an RDS Database instances.
When enabling encryption by setting the kms_key_id.
Misconfigurations.Message: Instance does not have storage encryption enabled.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable encryption for RDS instances

You can use the S3 Versioning feature to preserve, retrieve, and restore every version of every object stored in your buckets.

With versioning you can recover more easily from both unintended user actions and application failures.

When you enable versioning, also keep in mind the potential costs of storing noncurrent versions of objects. To help manage those costs, consider setting up an S3 Lifecycle configuration.

Misconfigurations.Message: Security group rule allows unrestricted ingress from any IP address.

Misconfigurations.Description: You should limit the provision of public IP addresses for resources. Resources should not be exposed on the public internet, but should have access limited to consumers required for the function of your application.
Misconfigurations.Message: Subnet associates public IP address.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set the instance to not be publicly accessible

Misconfigurations.Message: Instance does not have Deletion Protection enabled

Misconfigurations.Title: ':latest' tag used
Misconfigurations.Description: When using a 'FROM' statement you should use a specific tag to avoid uncontrolled behavior when the image is updated.
Misconfigurations.Message: Specify a tag in the 'FROM' statement for image 'ubuntu'
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Add a tag to the image in the 'FROM' statement

Misconfigurations.Title: Image user should not be 'root'
Misconfigurations.Description: Running containers with 'root' user can lead to a container escape situation. It is a best practice to run containers as non-root users, which can be done by adding a 'USER' statement to the Dockerfile.
Misconfigurations.Message: Last USER command in Dockerfile should not be 'root'
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Add 'USER <non root user name>' line to the Dockerfile

Misconfigurations.Title: Port 22 exposed
Misconfigurations.Description: Exposing port 22 might allow users to SSH into the container.
Misconfigurations.Message: Port 22 should not be exposed in Dockerfile
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Remove 'EXPOSE 22' statement from the Dockerfile

Misconfigurations.Title: RUN using 'wget' and 'curl'
Misconfigurations.Description: Avoid using both 'wget' and 'curl' since these tools have the same effect.
Misconfigurations.Message: Shouldn't use both curl and wget
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Pick one util, either 'wget' or 'curl'

Misconfigurations.Title: 'apt-get' missing '--no-install-recommends'
Misconfigurations.Description: 'apt-get' install should use '--no-install-recommends' to minimize image size.
Misconfigurations.Message: '--no-install-recommends' flag is missed: 'apt-get install -y     gcc     make     build-essential     gdb     strace'
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Add '--no-install-recommends' flag to 'apt-get'

Misconfigurations.Title: Secrets passed via `build-args` or envs or copied secret files
Misconfigurations.Description: Passing secrets via `build-args` or envs or copying secret files can leak them out
Misconfigurations.Message: Possible exposure of secret env "ADMIN_PASSWORD" in ENV
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Use secret mount if secrets are needed during image build. Use volume mount if secret files are needed during container runtime.

Misconfigurations.Title: Secrets passed via `build-args` or envs or copied secret files
Misconfigurations.Description: Passing secrets via `build-args` or envs or copying secret files can leak them out
Misconfigurations.Message: Possible exposure of secret env "API_KEY" in ENV
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Use secret mount if secrets are needed during image build. Use volume mount if secret files are needed during container runtime.

Misconfigurations.Resolution: Use secret mount if secrets are needed during image build. Use volume mount if secret files are needed during container runtime.

Misconfigurations.Message: deployment vulnerable-app in default namespace should not set spec.template.spec.containers.ports.containerPort to less than 1024
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Do not map the container ports to privileged host ports when starting a container.

Misconfigurations.Title: Default security context configured
Misconfigurations.Description: Security context controls the allocation of security parameters for the pod/container/volume, ensuring the appropriate level of protection. Relying on default security context may expose vulnerabilities to potential attacks that rely on privileged access.
Misconfigurations.Message: deployment vulnerable-app in default namespace is using the default security context, which allows root privileges
Misconfigurations.Resolution: To enhance security, it is strongly recommended not to rely on the default security context. Instead, it is advisable to explicitly define the required security parameters (such as runAsNonRoot, capabilities, readOnlyRootFilesystem, etc.) within the security context.

Misconfigurations.Title: CloudWatch log groups should be encrypted using CMK
Misconfigurations.Description: CloudWatch log groups are encrypted by default, however, to get the full benefit of controlling key rotation and other KMS aspects a KMS CMK should be used.
Misconfigurations.Message: Log group is not encrypted.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable CMK encryption of CloudWatch Log Groups

Misconfigurations.Title: aws_instance should activate session tokens for Instance Metadata Service.
Misconfigurations.Description: IMDS v2 (Instance Metadata Service) introduced session authentication tokens which improve security when talking to IMDS. By default aws_instance resource sets IMDS session auth tokens to be optional. To fully protect IMDS you need to enable session tokens by using metadata_options block and its http_tokens variable set to required.
Misconfigurations.Message: Instance does not require IMDS access to require a token.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable HTTP token requirement for IMDS

Misconfigurations.Title: Load balancers should drop invalid headers
Misconfigurations.Description:
Passing unknown or invalid headers through to the target poses a potential risk of compromise.
By setting drop_invalid_header_fields to true, anything that does not conform to well known, defined headers will be removed by the load balancer.
Misconfigurations.Message: Application load balancer is not set to drop invalid headers.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set drop_invalid_header_fields to true

Misconfigurations.Title: Load balancer is exposed to the internet.
Misconfigurations.Description: There are many scenarios in which you would want to expose a load balancer to the wider internet, but this check exists as a warning to prevent accidental exposure of internal assets. You should ensure that this resource should be exposed publicly.
Misconfigurations.Message: Load balancer is exposed publicly.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Switch to an internal load balancer or add a tfsec ignore

Misconfigurations.Title: RDS Cluster and RDS instance should have backup retention longer than default 1 day
Misconfigurations.Description: RDS backup retention for clusters defaults to 1 day, this may not be enough to identify and respond to an issue. Backup retention periods should be set to a period that is a balance on cost and limiting risk.
Misconfigurations.Message: Instance has very low backup retention period.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Explicitly set the retention period to greater than the default

Misconfigurations.Title: RDS encryption has not been enabled at a DB Instance level.
Misconfigurations.Description:
Encryption should be enabled for an RDS Database instances.
When enabling encryption by setting the kms_key_id.
Misconfigurations.Message: Instance does not have storage encryption enabled.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable encryption for RDS instances

Misconfigurations.Title: S3 Access block should block public ACL
Misconfigurations.Description: S3 buckets should block public ACLs on buckets and any objects they contain. By blocking, PUTs with fail if the object has any public ACL a.
Misconfigurations.Message: Public access block does not block public ACLs
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable blocking any PUT calls with a public ACL specified

Misconfigurations.Title: S3 Access block should block public policy
Misconfigurations.Description: S3 bucket policy should have block public policy to prevent users from putting a policy that enable public access.
Misconfigurations.Message: Public access block does not block public policies
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Prevent policies that allow public access being PUT

Misconfigurations.Title: Unencrypted S3 bucket.
Misconfigurations.Description: S3 Buckets should be encrypted to protect the data that is stored within them if access is compromised.
Misconfigurations.Message: Bucket does not have encryption enabled
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Configure bucket encryption

Misconfigurations.Title: S3 Bucket Logging
Misconfigurations.Description: Ensures S3 bucket logging is enabled for S3 buckets
Misconfigurations.Message: Bucket has logging disabled
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Add a logging block to the resource to enable access logging

Misconfigurations.Title: S3 Data should be versioned
Misconfigurations.Description:
Versioning in Amazon S3 is a means of keeping multiple variants of an object in the same bucket.

You can use the S3 Versioning feature to preserve, retrieve, and restore every version of every object stored in your buckets.

With versioning you can recover more easily from both unintended user actions and application failures.

When you enable versioning, also keep in mind the potential costs of storing noncurrent versions of objects. To help manage those costs, consider setting up an S3 Lifecycle configuration.
Misconfigurations.Message: Bucket does not have versioning enabled
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable versioning to protect against accidental/malicious removal or modification

Misconfigurations.Title: S3 Access Block should Ignore Public ACL
Misconfigurations.Description: S3 buckets should ignore public ACLs on buckets and any objects they contain. By ignoring rather than blocking, PUT calls with public ACLs will still be applied but the ACL will be ignored.
Misconfigurations.Message: Public access block does not ignore public ACLs
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable ignoring the application of public ACLs in PUT calls

Misconfigurations.Title: S3 Buckets not publicly accessible through ACL.
Misconfigurations.Description: Buckets should not have ACLs that allow public access
Misconfigurations.Message: Bucket has a public ACL: "public-read"
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Don't use canned ACLs or switch to private acl

Misconfigurations.Title: S3 Access block should restrict public bucket to limit access
Misconfigurations.Description: S3 buckets should restrict public policies for the bucket. By enabling, the restrict_public_buckets, only the bucket owner and AWS Services can access if it has a public policy.
Misconfigurations.Message: Public access block does not restrict public buckets
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Limit the access to public buckets to only the owner or AWS Services (eg; CloudFront)

Misconfigurations.Title: A security group rule should not allow unrestricted egress to any IP address.
Misconfigurations.Description: Opening up ports to connect out to the public internet is generally to be avoided. You should restrict access to IP addresses or ranges that are explicitly required where possible.
Misconfigurations.Message: Security group rule allows unrestricted egress to any IP address.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set a more restrictive cidr range

Misconfigurations.Title: Security groups should not allow unrestricted ingress to SSH or RDP from any IP address.
Misconfigurations.Description:
Security groups provide stateful filtering of ingress and egress network traffic to AWS
resources. It is recommended that no security group allows unrestricted ingress access to
remote server administration ports, such as SSH to port 22 and RDP to port 3389.
Misconfigurations.Message: Security group rule allows unrestricted ingress from any IP address.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set a more restrictive CIDR range

Misconfigurations.Title: Missing description for security group rule.
Misconfigurations.Description:
Security group rules should include a description for auditing purposes.

Simplifies auditing, debugging, and managing security groups.
Misconfigurations.Message: Security group rule does not have a description.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Add descriptions for all security groups rules

Misconfigurations.Title: Instance with unencrypted block device.
Misconfigurations.Description: Block devices should be encrypted to ensure sensitive data is held securely at rest.
Misconfigurations.Message: Root block device is not encrypted.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Turn on encryption for all block devices

Misconfigurations.Title: VPC Flow Logs is a feature that enables you to capture information about the IP traffic going to and from network interfaces in your VPC.
